data.title: My best friend's hangout
data.text: My best friend used to live in Topeka. When I went to a concert in Topeka memorializing him, it seemed only fitting to go to his favorite lunch place. It's not fancy (think TV sports and pool tables) and the decor is dated, but the food is quite good. And I swear that was one of the very best Bloody Marys I've ever had! The service is great; the staff members are very kind. By far the best place to eat in downtown.

data.title: Great food, great prices
data.text: Cold beer, great service, very reasonable prices. Open late, including kitchen. Will definitely go back when in The Top!

data.title: Hot wings
data.text: Me and my family have been going there for years the staff is usually great there are a few waitresses that need to be kicked out on the sidewalk. But you have to eat their hot wings this bar is like a veteran bar there's a lot of regulars and older groups of people. Downside there's a liquor store right next door so you have drunks and idiots outside. First share this bar does not tolerate any riffraff walking in off the street one of my favorite places to drink

data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: This place serves the best homestyle cheeseburger, fries with country gravy. The gravy is a must! Friendly staff, cold beer and reasonably priced.

data.title: Quiet 'Neigborhood' Bar/Grill where everyone is 'neighborly'
data.text:
It's not too much of a stretch to think you've entered a neighborhood bar with the warm, welcoming atmosphere with a lot of wood accents for a warm feel upon entering.  The proprietor had donated a gift certificate to support the local Shriner's organization and I won it in the silent auction. I've known Terry casually for many years through golf activities and he is one restaurant owner that pays attention to what is going on and in, and around, his namesake. He is usually in attendance but not last Saturday evening; you wouldn't have known it because his professional waitstaff hustled the duration of our visit serving the bustling crowd.

Upon entering, we found one open booth as the main dining room was almost full with patrons and a large family was occupying the west dining area. Within seconds of my wife and I sitting down, our attentive waitress (Alyson) was there to welcome us and take our drink orders. She provided excellent service from start to finish and had a 'can do' attitude.

My wife ordered the single Angus burger and a side of fries  (which are very generous) and she was very complimentary. I had a 'hankering' for a chicken fried steak so I ignored the distractions on the menu and ordered it with the fries and the steak smothered in gravy.  The worst thing I can say about our entire meal, and experience, was this entree was a little bland for my taste. Our tab, before gift certificate, with a beer, tax, and tip was less than $22! and we both left wanting for naught. I guarantee I'll be back and next time I am going to take a crack at one of the steak dinners on the menu (popular choice among the diners near our booth).

This is my first written review of Terry's but I entertain some downtown business clients here throughout the year. The menu is so extensive with sandwich / entree choices for lunch (and so reasonably priced) that it is fun to experiment with the different choices just to be different or to fit your appetite du jour.  

For visitors passing through, I recommend this if it fits your itinerary as it is within a mile of Interstate 70 on the west side of our downtown.

data.title: First Timer
data.text: This place is great for lunch!  Quick service, attentive servers and perfect lunch type sandwiches that are very reasonably priced and are not over the top huge so you are less productive in the afternoon at work.  I could also see having a beer or two here after work

data.title: It was okay...
data.text: Well, I went to eat here with two of my coworkers. The waitress was fairly prompt. I ordered a chicken fried steak dinner. The prices were good, but the portions were small. The steak was ok, but the mashed potatoes could have been better. My female coworker asked for no tomato, and they slapped a big one on the top of her salad. She asked for medium done steak, it came bloody like they'd just killed the cow. I probably will not return.

data.title: Great late night eats
data.text: A Topeka tradition for late-night eats. I like their chicken fried steak sandwich. This is a great place to go for good bar food.

data.title: Great tacos and nice friendly folks.
data.text: Great little neighborhood bar. Friendly folks from all walks of life, calm atmosphere, and the $.75 taco night was beyond belief.

data.title: Food is average
data.text: Food is OK, beer was cheap.  Service was uneven - some folks were nice, others crabby.  Go for Chili Dog Monday- $1 each at lunchtime.

data.title: Really good offerings
data.text: Went to Jerry's with 7 business associates. Everyone ordered something different and all the meals looked great!  I had the grilled chicken salad and it was fresh, with the chicken nicely grilled.  I really wanted the Angus Burger but opted for the lighter choice. When I saw the angus burger, I had to look away adit looked scrumptious.  Lots of choices here. Nothing fancy in the decor. Obviously a popular dining spot and hangout.

data.title: Great food and reasonably priced
data.text: Four of us, one bacon double cheeseburger, two tenderloin sandwiches, and my KC strip steak. All were excellent. My steak, albeit only 8 oz., was cooked perfectly and that's hard to do when it is 1/2" thick. Excellent service. It has been a few years since I have been here but nothing has changed about the quality of food. I will return here.

data.title: Great Place !  Check it out
data.text: This is above your average bar food.  Great wait staff and cold beverages.  Menu is HUGE and everything we had was very good.  Surprises you.  Very nice decor.  We love it here !!

data.title: For a bar and grill- great!
data.text: I have been going to Terry's for years.  Always get the Black Angus steakburger with spicey fries.  Wait staff are great.  Quiet enough to talk.

data.title: Above average pub grub
data.text: Very large offering of sandwiches and other meals.  One of the best pork tenderloin sandwiches in town.  Black Angus burgers and fried mushrooms with horseradish sauce are excellent.  Lunch is crowded, and parking is mostly on the adjacent street, as the spaces around the building are always full.  Terry the owner is almost always there to run the place - as he has been for 25 or 30 years!  Very loyal customer base for lunch includes a lot of downtown Topeka business people, legistators and local judges.

data.title: Good as Usual!
data.text:
Hadn't been to Terry's in awhile. Server was friendly, service as one would expect, food excellant, and drink refills timely.  The establishment was clean and prices appropiate for food, service, type of establishment and area.  
Would highly recommend Terry's for a casual meal with friend, family, co-workers and some casual business dealings.

data.title: Great burgers good salads, and all the beer....
data.text: Honest portions of local fare with good service even in rush lunch hour.

data.title: Great sandwiches
data.text: Very clean, great sandwiches, variety is super and wait staff is very attentive.

data.title: great atmosphere and bar food
data.text: When visiting friends in Topeka we often end up at Terry`s. A  great neighborhood bar that beats the heck out of Appleby`s and all the rest of the chain bar and grill places. The wait staff is friendly and helpful the beer is cold and the food is good,,,eveything you hope to get at this type of establishment.

data.title: Great place to eat and drink
data.text: Even though located one block west of 10th. and Topeka Blvd. it is fairly safe.  The surrounding area is rather sketchy though.  The food and service is tops.  Many varieties of burgers and drinks are good. Numerous TV's also along with pool tables.
